title: Carbon Revolution seeks up to $90.6m for IPO
text:
Carbon fire wheels company Carbon Revolution is seeking to raise $88.3 million to $90.6 million for its initial public offering.

Lead managers Bell Potter and Evans Dixon blasted terms to potential investors on Monday, outlining a $30 million primary raising and secondary selldown worth up to another $60.6 million.

Carbon Revolution's carbon fibre wheels are about 40 per cent lighter than normal wheels. Penny Stephens

Shares were offered at $2.20 to $2.80 each in a deal that would value the company at $248.3 million to $305.5 million on an enterprise value basis.

The deal was priced at 3.9-times to 4.9-times forecast revenue for the 2020 financial year.

Funds raised were pegged for capital expenditure ($9.9 million), research and development ($6.4 million), working capital ($4.8 million) and prepayment of a loan ($5 million).
description: Carbon fire wheels company Carbon Revolution is seeking to raise $88.3 million to $90.6 million for its initial public offering.
